page.title: 10Blackmore Priory Church
page.content: The Domesday name for this area is Fingrith Manor but "Blackmore" comes from the supposed blackish soil around.As far as{religion}was concerned the Priory,owned by the Augustinian Priors,was founded by the de Sandford family and dedicated to St.Lawrence.During the{Black Death } Plague about 300 tenants died.During the Dissolution of the Monastries by Henry V111,John Smyth dimolished half of the Priory until villagers stopped him.A 13th century{cresset stone}was found and is now on display within the {church}.The timber{tower}was built in 1475 and is the most impressive in England.It's built in three stages with impressive struts,beams and arched braces standing upon a 30ft. base.The largest of five{bells}weighs \ a ton and 3 were cast by Miles Grey famous for his tenor bells.{
